title: A unified framework for dataset shift diagnostics. (arXiv:2205.08340v3 [stat.ML] UPDATED)
abstract: Most supervised learning methods assume that the data used in the training phase comes from the target population. However, in practice, one often faces dataset shift, which, if not adequately taken into account, may decrease the performance of their predictors. In this work, we propose a novel and flexible framework called DetectShift that enables quantification and testing of various types of dataset shifts, including shifts in the distributions of $(X, Y)$, $X$, $Y$, $X|Y$, and $Y|X$. DetectShift provides practitioners with insights about changes in their data, allowing them to leverage source and target data to retrain or adapt their predictors. That is particularly valuable in scenarios where labeled samples from the target domain are scarce. translated_abstract: 大多数监督学习方法假定训练阶段使用的数据来自目标人口。然而，在实际应用中，人们经常面临数据集偏移，如果不充分考虑，可能会降低预测器的性能。本文提出了一个称为DetectShift的新颖灵活的框架，可以量化和测试各种类型的数据集偏移，包括$(X，Y)$，$X$，$Y$，$X|Y$和$Y|X$分布的差异。DetectShift为从业人员提供有关其数据变化的见解，使他们能够利用源数据和目标数据重新训练或调整其预测器，特别适用于目标域缺乏标记样本的情况。该框架利用具有相同状态的检验统计量来量化各种偏移的大小，使结果更易于解释。此外，它既可以应用于回归和分类任务，也可以应用于不同类型的模型。
tldr: 本文提出了一个名为DetectShift的新框架，可用于量化和测试各种数据集偏移，并帮助从业人员了解数据变化，使机器学习模型更加鲁棒。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a new framework called DetectShift for quantifying and testing dataset shift, which provides insight into changes in the data and helps practitioners make machine learning models more robust.
